[anchor|#section_cj2_zwc_tmb] Form ID: ([~/?ScreenId=PM654000|PM654000])((({S:Warn}This report is available only if the ''Construction'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form. ))) The report shows the selected project gross profit as the difference between the actual revenue and actual costs of the project. Also, the report shows the gross markup for the project, calculated as the ratio of its gross profit to its actual costs ('''Gross Markup'''), the ratio of the difference between the revised and actual costs to the revised costs of the project ( '''% of Estimate Used'''), ratio of the revised project revenues to the actual incomes ('''% of Contract Billed''') and the difference between the revised project revenue and its actual incomes ('''Outstanding to Bill'''). [anchor|#_1b92e7e5-0472-42a4-be74-912ac2f52fb2]{br}

Project WIP Form ID: (PM651000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM651000|PM651000])This report gives you a way to track the progress and financial performance of project contracts while using that data to forecast future performance. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Organization : The name of the company for which you want to view the report. By default, the company to which you are currently signed in is selected. Branch : The name of the branch for which you want to view the report. By default, the branch to which you are currently signed in is selected. As of Date : The date for which the values in the report are displayed. By default, the current date is selected. Status : The status of the project for which you want to view the report, which is one of the following: Active (default) Completed Active and Completed Exclude Projects Completed Through Date : If before or on this date projects have been completed, they are not displayed in this report. By default, this box is cleared. Project : The project for which you want to view the report. You select the project to view the report for only this particular project, or leave the box blank to view the report for all projects.

Form ID: ([~/?ScreenId=PM651500|PM651500])((({S:Warn}This report is available only if the ''Construction'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form. ))) This work-in-progress report tracks the progress of active jobs, as well as their financial performance within the specified period of time and use this data to forecast future performance. In addition to looking at the percentage of completion and the cost to complete, the report also helps to analyze whether a project is overbilled or underbilled in relation to its current progress of completion.[anchor|#_f52dd5ec-7e11-4f6f-8362-1314f76b1a63]{br}
See below for a description of each parameter on the '''Report Parameters''' tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see [HelpRoot_Interface\Report_Processing_Options|Reports]. ==Report Parameters== On the '''Report Parameters''' tab, you use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report:[anchor|#_a71b2731-6162-4c60-947e-ccc31e2db63f] *'''Organization''': The name of the company for which you want to view the report. By default, the company to which you are currently signed in is selected. *'''Branch''': The name of the branch for which you want to view the report. By default, the branch to which you are currently signed in is selected. *'''From Period''': The starting financial period of the range of periods the report will cover. You must select a period. By default, the current financial period is specified. *'''To Period''': The ending financial period of the range of periods the report will cover. You must select a period. By default, the current financial period is specified. *:The transactions for the specified period range are included in '''Period Costs''' and '''Period Billings''' columns of the report. *'''Status''': The status of the project for which you want to view the report, which is one of the following: **''Active'' (default) **''Completed'' ** ''Active and Completed'' * '''Project''': The project for which you want to view the work-in-progress report. You select the project to view the report for only this particular project, or leave the box blank to view the report for all projects. *'''As of Date''': The date for which the values in the report are displayed. The transactions to this date will be summed up in the '''Costs to Date''' and '''Billings to Date''' columns of the report. By default, the current date is selected. *'''Exclude Projects Completed Through Date''': If this check box is selected, the completed projects with the '''End Date''' equal to the specified '''As of Date''' are not displayed in the report. By default, this check box is cleared.

RFIs Outstanding Form ID: (PJ664000) ([~/?ScreenId=PJ664000|PJ664000])This report displays the list of outstanding requests for information. [anchor|#section_a1l_rwt_5mb] Form ID: ([~/?ScreenId=FS631000|FS631000])((({S:Warn}This report is available only if the ''Construction'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form. ))) The report shows revenue and costs related to the selected service order and the profit calculated as the difference between them.[anchor|#_8575a22b-1a2e-413e-aa52-e772592375f0]{br}

For more information about using other elements on the report form, see [HelpRoot_Interface\Report_Processing_Options|Reports].{br}{TOC}[anchor|#section_p1l_rwt_5mb] ==Report Parameters{collapsable}== On the '''Report Parameters ''' tab, you use the following parameters to select the data to be displayed on the report: [anchor|#_5bb0d61b-baa1-4528-8a18-97b79faf1c5b] *'''Start Date''': The start date for which you want to view data. *'''End Date''': The end date for which you want to view data. By default, the current business date is selected. *'''Service Order Type''': The service order type related to the service order you want to display. You must specify the type. *'''Service Order Number''': The number of the service order you want to display. You must specify the number of the service order. *'''Customer : Service Location''': The customer whose location is used as the service location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. *'''Location''': The customer location for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customer locations. *'''Bill Customer''': The customer who is billed for the service order for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all customers. *'''Inventory''': The service, non-stock item, or stock item for which you want to view data. Leave the box blank to view data on all inventory items. *'''Open Service Orders Only''': A check box that you select to include open service orders only in the report.

For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date of the date range of the report; a start date must be specified. End Date : The end date of the date range; a date must be specified here as well. Only subcontracts having dates that fall within the specified interval will be included in the report. Vendor ID : The vendor for which you want to view subcontract information, by its ID. You can select a vendor to view only subcontracts created for this vendor, or leave the box blank to view a broader range of data. Inventory ID : The non-stock item for which you want to view subcontract information. Select the inventory ID of the non-stock item to view only subcontracts created for purchasing this item.

Subcontract Summary Form ID: (SC610500) ([~/?ScreenId=SC610500|SC610500])For a particular date range, this report shows summary information about the subcontracts that are neither closed nor canceled. The information presented for each subcontract includes the reference number, subcontract date, status, currency, vendor ID and name, ordered quantity, open quantity, line total, and open amount. The report also includes total values (for all subcontracts included in the report) for the ordered quantity, open quantity, line total, and open amount. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Start Date : The start date of the date range to be reported on. A start date must be selected. End Date : The end date of the date range; an end date must be selected. Only the subcontracts having dates that fall within the specified interval will be included in the report. Vendor ID : The vendor for which you want to view subcontract information, by its ID. You can select a vendor to view only subcontracts created for this vendor, or leave the box blank to view a broader range of data. Inventory ID : The non-stock item for which you want to view subcontract information. Select the ID of the non-stock to view only subcontracts created for purchasing this item.

row.PlainText: Submittal Form Form ID: (PJ663000) ([~/?ScreenId=PJ663000|PJ663000])The report displays details of a submittal. this form can be printed or send by email. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameters to select the information to be displayed on the report: Submittal ID : The submittal for which you want to view report. Select the submittal from the list of submittals created in the system. Revision ID : The revision number of the submittal for which you want to view subcontract information. By default, 0 is selected..

row.column: Substantiated Billing Form ID: (PM650000) ([~/?ScreenId=PM650000|PM650000])This report is used as a proof of project costs. By using this report, you can review, print, and email a list of costs from payable invoices, labor, and other project expenses for a specific billing period. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Project : The identifier of the project for which the report is displayed. You need to select the ID of the project for which you want to generate a printable report. From Date : The start date of the date range for which the report is displayed. By default, the first date of the current month is selected. To Date : The end date of the date range for which the report is displayed. By default, the current business date is selected.

Substantiated Billing - Consolidated Form ID: (PM650050) ([~/?ScreenId=PM650050|PM650050])This report is used as a proof of project costs. By using this report, you can review, print, and email a list of costs from payable invoices, labor, and other project expenses . The generated report includes all scanned or uploaded images of the PNG, JPG, JPEG, BMP, GIF, TIFF or TIF format attached to the corresponding cost records of a project for a specified billing period. When the report is generated, a PDF copy of the images are attached as a separate pages within the same PDF. In addition, the generated PDF includes hyperlinks to the attached files that could not be included directly to the report file (such as, for example, encrypted PDF files). See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, you use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Project : The identifier of the project for which the report is displayed. You need to select the ID of the project for which you want to generate a print-friendly report. From Date : The start date of the date range for which the report is displayed. By default, the first date of the current month is selected. To Date : The end date of the date range for which the report is displayed. By default, the current business date is selected.

Vendor Transaction History Form ID: (PM706220) ([~/?ScreenId=PM706220|PM706220])This report displays the transactions related to the selected vendor (or all vendors) during the selected date range. For each vendor, documents are grouped by project and listed by reference number. You can see each document's dates and amounts. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Vendor : The identifier of the vendor for whom you want to view the report. Select a vendor from the list of active vendors, or leave the box blank to view information about all vendors. Project : The project for which the history of transactions to be displayed. Select a project identifier for which you want to view the report, or leave the box blank to view information about all projects. Date From : The date from which the history of transactions will be displayed. By default, the first date of the current period is selected. Date To : The date until which the history of transactions will be displayed. By default, the current business date is selected. Report Format : The format of the report displayed. Select one of the following options: Summary : To view summary information on each bill such as bill date, billed amount, amount paid, and the current balance of the bill. Detailed : To view detailed information on transactions for each bill such as transaction reference numbers, types, dates, and amount.

row.PlainText: Uncond Waiver - Final Pymt Form ID: (CL642004) ([~/?ScreenId=CL642004|CL642004])This report provides a sample release of the remaining lien rights when the current payment has been received and no future payments are expected. See below for a description of each parameter on the Report Parameters tab of the report form. For more information about using other elements on the report form, see Reports. You can specify the lien waiver number or leave this box blank to view the report for multiple lien waivers.

Report Parameters On the Report Parameters tab, use the following parameter to select the information to be displayed on the report: Lien Waiver : The lien waiver for which you want to view the report. You can specify the lien waiver number or leave this box blank to view the report for multiple lien waivers.
